meanings.definition: A section or part of a larger area that has been divided into smaller parts
meanings.sent1: The city is divided into many subdivisions for easier management.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent showed us several subdivisions in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The subdivisions of the puzzle made it challenging to put together.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a map with intricate subdivisions of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The subdivisions of the forest were teeming with diverse wildlife.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing something into smaller parts
meanings.sent1: The subdivisions of the cake were perfectly equal slices.
meanings.sent2: The subdivisions of the project made it more manageable for the team.
meanings.sent3: His love for subdivisions of numbers made him a math enthusiast.
meanings.sent4: The subdivisions of time seemed to slip away faster than expected.
meanings.sent5: The subdivisions of the music piece added depth to the composition.

meanings.definition: A smaller group within a larger group
meanings.sent1: The subdivisions of the club catered to different interests.
meanings.sent2: The subdivisions of the team worked on specific tasks.
meanings.sent3: The subdivisions of the family tree revealed surprising connections.
meanings.sent4: The subdivisions of the organization brought together like-minded individuals.
meanings.sent5: The subdivisions of the population had unique characteristics.
